title: Stargazers Cosmic Watchlist
summary: A watchlist app for anime, films, TV, and games—built to be fast, searchable, and easy to share.
description: A type-safe watchlist built with Next.js, focused on everyday usefulness: quick filtering, shareable URLs, and an analytics dashboard that helps you spot habits and trends. It pulls in rich metadata from TMDB/OMDb and keeps the core flows simple and reliable.
highlights: Fast, server-driven CRUD with validation and Google sign-in.
Shareable filters so lists are easy to bookmark and send to friends.
Analytics that turn activity into simple, readable insights.

title: Photon Trail
summary: A personal finance dashboard that connects accounts, organizes transactions, and makes spending easier to understand.
description: A finance dashboard that prioritizes privacy and clarity: secure bank connections, automated categorization, and simple charts that make patterns obvious. Built with a server-first approach so the sensitive parts stay on the backend.
highlights: Secure account linking and sync with encrypted tokens.
Automated categorization that saves time and surfaces patterns.
A clean dashboard with protected routes and clear visuals.

title: Cosmic Digest
summary: A lightweight news digest that filters noise, spots trends, and sends scheduled updates.
description: A .NET worker that pulls RSS feeds, scores relevance, tags topics, and emails a clean digest on a schedule. It’s designed to be hands-off: consistent runs, predictable output, and easy to deploy.
highlights: Relevance scoring and topic tagging to keep feeds useful instead of overwhelming.
Trend signals and alerts so important shifts stand out.
Dockerized worker that runs consistently across environments.

title: Cosmic UI
summary: A small React component library focused on accessibility, consistency, and easy theming.
description: A lightweight component library published to npm/GitHub Packages. It wraps accessible primitives, standardizes styling patterns, and uses CSS variables so themes stay flexible without being fragile.
highlights: Accessible primitives wrapped in clean, variant-driven APIs.
Themeable via CSS variables for simple light/dark swaps.
Automated publishing so releases stay consistent and low-friction.
